snippet: Vital endowment agencies are struggling to operate because of Washington’s inaction and severe budget cuts.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Obama administration for taking too long to nominate successors for National Endowment for the Arts and National Endowment for the Humanities; cites urgency for White House to find persuasive leaders for both agencies to explain why culture is central to a civilized society, particularly in light of Republican threats to cut budgets for cultural programs.
lead_paragraph: Vital endowment agencies are struggling to operate because of Washington’s inaction and severe budget cuts.

headline.main: Trifling With the Arts and Humanities
